)

Compute up to 3rd order C.d.i. of an image.

Finds the first 8 Cartesian differential invariants of an image. That is 1x1st order, 3x2nd order and 4x3rd order. The results are returned in 8 adjacent planes (for each input plane) The results are unscaled. If the range of your input is , you can normalise the results by dividing the planes by

See Romeny et al. Proc.IPMI1993, pp77-93. and Walker et al. Proc.BMVC1997 pp541-549.

Parameters:
max_kernel_width.Set this value (to an odd number) if you want to restrict the size of the kernel. 0 will let the function choose an appropriate kernel size for the scale.
